title: Authors and Citation

code: @Manual{,   title = {firekit: General purpose toolkit for the Fire Centre},   author = {Todd Ellis and Grant Williamson and Amila Wickramasinghe and Stefania Ondei},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.0.2.600},   url = {https://fire-centre.github.io/firekit/}, }

what: General purpose toolkit for the Fire Centre
title: General purpose toolkit for the Fire Centre
text: R package containing variety functions developed University Tasmania Fire Centre. includes functions calculating range fire weather indices, calculating spatial landscape metrics fire regime rasters, spatial model urban-rural fire risk incorporating radiant heat ember transport. Package development support Natural Hazards Research Australia project Bushfire Risk Urban-Rural Interface.

calc_lsm — calc_lsm
text: Calculate landscape metrics using circular moving window.

title: calc_lsm — calc_lsm
code: calc_lsm(   raster_list,   category = c("hts", "tsf", "tsfc", "fesm", "other"),   folder_out,   year = NULL,   window_n = 3,   lsm = NULL,   mask = NULL,   overwrite = FALSE,   plot = FALSE )

title: calc_lsm — calc_lsm
text: raster_list List raster files single raster file path calculate lsm . category Type categorical data assess. N.B. Designed listed categories – use '' test different data, ensure pre-processed satisfaction. folder_out Output folder save processed rasters. year Optional year calculate, used filter raster_list. Assumes year file name. window_n Window size use moving window. lsm Vector list landscape metrics calculate. NULL, calculates every available option landscapemetrics package. mask Optional mask apply calculating landscape metrics. overwrite Flag overwrite existing file . plot Flag print plot output writing data file.

title: fire_tbl — fire_tbl
text: query SQL SELECT query SCHEMA.TABLE EDW reference. db Database name path//database/object. reset Logical Denotes whether reset connection object (con). Useful needing turn writable /change databases. writable Logical re: making connection writeable. Warning: one individual can connected database writable connection time. kid int : User ID number accessing list stored credentials via keyring. typically 1 unless multiple credentials stored one system.

theme_fire — theme_fire
text: Use Fire Centre-preferred ggplot2 theme. Default sizing tends work well Quarto publications.

title: theme_fire — theme_fire
code: theme_fire(   axis.title = 14,   axis.text = 10,   strip.text = 10.5,   legend.text = 10.25,   strip.bg = "white",   plot.bg = "white",   line.col = "#838383" )

title: theme_fire — theme_fire
text: axis.title Text size axis title. axis.text Text size axis text. strip.text Text size facet strips. legend.text Text size legend. line_col Color axis lines ticks; defaults dark grey.

title: theme_fire — theme_fire
text: Theme ready adding ggplot2 object.

title: theme_fire — theme_fire
code: tibble::tibble(x = 1:10,                y = 10:1) |>  ggplot2::ggplot(ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) +  ggplot2::geom_point() +  theme_fire()

title: threshold_curve — threshold_curve
text: Reframe data extracting threshold exploring causal relationships.

title: threshold_curve — threshold_curve
code: threshold_curve(   df,   x,   y,   n_range = 100,   dir = c(">", "<"),   extend = NULL,   rescale = FALSE )

title: threshold_curve — threshold_curve
text: df Dataframe x Variable threshold identified (x axis) y Variable used identify constraining threshold (y axis) n_range Number values use blow x axis identify threshold. dir Direction along x axis constraining threshold. extend Value 0 1 blow x axis (sometimes important threshold near upper lower limits; can crash model) rescale Whether rescale y axis 0 1.

title: threshold_curve — threshold_curve
text: Dataframe prepared threshold_nls(...)

title: threshold_curve — threshold_curve
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   threshold_curve(mtcars, mpg, cyl, n_range = 25, dir = ">", extend = 0.1, rescale = F) } # }

title: threshold_nls — threshold_nls
text: Identify extract potential threshold comparing two variables.

title: threshold_nls — threshold_nls
code: threshold_nls(df, x, y, dir = ">", plot = FALSE)

title: threshold_nls — threshold_nls
text: df Dataframe output threshold_curve. x Variable threshold identified (x axis) y Variable used identify constraining threshold (y axis) plot Binary determining whether automatically plot relationships assess ouput.

title: threshold_nls — threshold_nls
text: Output broom::tidy() nls models.

title: threshold_nls — threshold_nls
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{   threshold_curve(mtcars, mpg, cyl, n_range = 25, dir = ">", extend = 0.1, rescale = F) |>     threshold_nls(mpg, cyl, dir = ">", plot = TRUE) } # }
